Description: Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributed Dataset.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributing Team.
Name of the ASAP CRN Team. i.e. "TEAM-LEE","TEAM-HAFLER","TEAM-HARDY",etc.
Lab name that is submitting dataset for the ASAP CRN Team.
Title of the overall project.
Brief description of the goals and objectives of the project.
Title for this dataset.
Brief description specific to the dataset.
A unique name is required for each data submission, as one project can generate and submit multiple datasets.  snakecase.
Full name of the lab Principal Investigator. Format. First name, Initial, Last name
E-mail address of the Principle Investigator of the Lab submitting the data.
Names of all contributors to the dataset. Format. First name, Initial, Last name ; First name, Initial, Last name ; ..
Full name of individual submitting data.
Email address of individual submitting data.
ID of the ASAP grant funding the study.  e.g. ASAP-000xxx
Details of other funding contributing to data generation.
Digital Object Identifer for pre-print(s). NA if not available.
Unique identifier for journal articles/abstracts in PubMed. NA if not available.
Total number of tissue samples in the dataset.
Enumeration of samples in this collection. e.g. Brain Regions, a list of all anatomical origins of brain samples.  This should be as specific as possible for this field. comma separated.
Description of samples.  e.g.late-stage PD and control postmortem brains
List of metadata tables for this dataset.
ASAP Access & Use Policy
Principle investigator ORCID.
Principle investigator Google Scholar reference.

Github repository link or similar code reference plus electronic lab notes detailing all data generation steps and quality control summaries.  Analysis scripts for additional processing will also create valuable context.
Metadata Version and/or Date
Alternate identification reference for dataset.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributed Dataset.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributing Team.
Short summary detailing how samples were collected.
Short summary detailing the protocols used for cell extraction.
Short summary detailing how the library was prepared.
Short summary of how data has been processed.
URL for lab github repo conatining the code and scripts for processing data in this dataset.
io DOI.  Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for `protocols.io`.
Link to technology/platform protocol(s) if not available in protocols.io
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.

This will be a unique ID for the subject.  The subject ID used by contributing team.  During Dataset Acceptance this may be modified by the ASAP team to prevent naming collisions, and to avoid spaces and ambiguity.
Subject ID issued by providing brain bank.
Name of the biobank from which the samples were sourced.
Genetically derived sex.
Reported race of subject. NINDS CDE for race. NOT genetic race.
Validation: ["American Indian or Alaska Native", "Asian", "White", "Black or African American", "Multi-racial", "Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander", "Other", "Unknown", "Not Reported"]

Description: The diagnosis of the subject.  Because subjects could have multple diagnoses, this is the PRIMARY diagnosis.
Validation: ["Healthy Control", "Idiopathic PD", "Alzheimer's disease", "Frontotemporal dementia", "Corticobasal syndrome", "Dementia with Lewy bodies", "Dopa-responsive dystonia", "Essential tremor", "Hemiparkinson/hemiatrophy syndrome", "Juvenile autosomal recessive parkinsonism", "Motor neuron disease with parkinsonism", "Multiple system atrophy", "Neuroleptic-induced parkinsonism", "Normal pressure hydrocephalus", "Progressive supranuclear palsy", "Psychogenic parkinsonism", "Vascular parkinsonism", "No PD nor other neurological disorder", "Spinocerebellar Ataxia (SCA)", "Prodromal non-motor PD", "Prodromal motor PD", "Other neurological disorder"]

Description: GP2 aligned diagnosis phenotype of the subject: PD - parkinsons disease, Control - no NDD diagnosis, Prodromal - prodromal parkinsons, Other - encompasses anything not in the above list for example diagnoses llike huntingtons, Not reported - missing, MSA - multiple system atrophy, PSP - progressive supranuclear palsy, DLB - dementia with lewey bodies, CBS - corticobasal degeneration, AD - alzheimers disease.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.
If the primary_diagnosis is "Other neurological disorders" diagnosis must be specified here.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.
Validation: can be assigned NULL for datasets where subject doesn't make sense

Description: ID of each individual sample used in the study (e.g. cortex of anterior cingulate gyrus); if from the same brain several regions are included in the study, each region (i.e. each sample) has different ID and listed as a separate entry.
Subject level ID for source of sample.
Used in place of subject_id for mouse studies.
Used in place of subject_id for ipsc/in vitro studies.
ID provided by Brain bank or other source.

Indicator for replicates of the sample.  Replicates could be biological or tecnical.  Indicate biological replicates as capitalized "Rep" + replicated number (i.e. Rep1, Rep2, etc) and technical replicates with lowercase "rep" + replicate number (i.e., rep1, rep2 etc.)
Number of replicates of this sample.  Typically this will be 1, but if replicates have been collected indicate how many total.
Indicator that this is a repeated sample.  This will be treated as a boolean.  i.e. enter 0 unless sample is a replicate.
Label to enumerate the batch. This will probablby numerica, but could be coded as letters.
Organism of the subject. Currently this is only "Human", "Mouse"
Type of tissue.  e.g. "Brain" or other organ.  For this PMDBS database it should always be "Brain".  "Colon", "iPSC", "Blood",  "CSF", etc.
Refers to the ASSAY_* table. Expand as nescessary
Code for the experimental condition of the sample. e.g. "PD", "Control", "Prodromal", "Other".  Defined further in CONDITION table.
Organisim ID according to the NCBITaxon e.g. 9606 for Homo Sapiens, 10090 for mouse
Numerical age of subject/animal at sample collection. Matches SUBJECT.'age_at_collection' for Human/PMDBS, matches MOUSE.age for Mouse datasets. days
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributed Dataset.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud for each contributing Team.
Time from baseline in days. Units in days, 0 is baseline to facilitate longitudinal analysis.
Alternate sample identifier. e.g. cell line
HsapDv if human. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/hsapdv
PATO:0000384 for male, PATO:0000383 for female, or unknown if unavailable.

HANCESTRO use multiethnic if more than one ethnicity is reported. If human and information unavailable, use unknown. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/hancestro

MONDO or PATO:0000461 for 'normal'. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo https://github.com/chanzuckerberg/single-cell-curation/blob/main/schema/3.0.0/schema.md#suspension_type

UBERON. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon  as per  https://github.com/chanzuckerberg/single-cell-curation/blob/main/schema/3.0.0/schema.md#suspension_type
EFO. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/efo
free-text identifier that distinguishes the unique individual that data were derived from. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE.
PH measured in the tissue. PH is designated as a number ranging between 0 and 14.
Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl
RIN provided by Tissue/Brain/Biobank, if applicable.
Value is the percentage of RNA fragments larger than 200 nucleotides.

Cell, nucleus, or na, as corresponding to assay. Included for compatibilty with CELLxGENE. Use https://github.com/chanzuckerberg/single-cell-curation/blob/main/schema/3.0.0/schema.md#suspension_type defined in the data schema for additional guidance.
Unique ID issued by ASAP CRN Cloud.

ID of each individual sample used in the study (e.g. cortex of anterior cingulate gyrus); if from the same brain several regions are included in the study, each region (i.e. each sample) has different ID and listed as a separate entry
Type of tissue.  e.g. "Brain" or other organ.  For this PMDBS database it should always be "Brain".
Technology used for the assay.  e.g. 'SN' for single Nuclei or 'SC' for single Cell.
Readout type. This will be "RNA" for most of the ASAP CRN data.
RIN is an algorithm for assigning integrity values to RNA measurements.
The molecular source of the data could be DNA, RNA or protein, for example.
Total count of cells (single cell or single nuclei) that were originally isolated and processed for capture. I.e. cell suspension concentration * volume injected.
Assay performed and Version.  Validation Enum can be added to as additional Assays are contributed.
Validation: ["v3.1 - Dual Index","v3.1 - Single Index","v2 - Dual Index", "v1", "Xenium In Situ","v1.1 - Single Index", "v2", "Other","GeoMx Hu WTA"]

Description: Specification sequencing type. Single End vs. Paired-End.
Nominal Number of base pairs sequenced.
The instrument used to perform sequencing.   Illumina NovaSeq 6000 recommended by protocols alignment group leads.
Validation: ["Illumina NovaSeq 6000", "llumina HiSeq 2500", "Illumina HiSeq 3000", "Illumina HiSeq 4000", "Illumina NextSeq 550", "Illumina HiSeq X Ten", "Illumina HiSeq X Five", "Illumina MiSeq", "on Torrent PGM", "Ion Torrent Proton", "Ion Torrent S5", "Ion Torrent S5 XL", "PacBio RS", "PacBio RS II", "Other"]

Description: Full name of file containing the sample data.  For paired-end data (e.g. `sequencing_end` = "single") the ROOT of the file can be specified, and the others will be inferred.

Checksum hash of the uploaded file using MD5.
Indication of whether the data has been adjusted.  i.e. Is the data "raw" or "processed"?
Description of file content. What is the variable measurement values?

Additional annotation columns present in file. I.e. 'tissue','UMI','barcode','cluster', or'cell location' .. Additional colunns in the annData or HDF files when relevant to technologies like single cell or spatial. ['SNP','ENSG','interval'] SNP is rsID or positional annotation. Interval is in chr_start_stop format. ENSG is ensemble ID.
Reference file: Incl. software version, reference assembly, parameters for analysis, in YAML format
